posts.post_content:
This thing is hard to kill. Hard. The best solution is O-ring, Pacifism, but the worst part is that it almost always brings some [Abrupt Decay](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Abrupt Decay)s with it.  
  
Oh, and it is played in decks where the player *wants* creature cards in his graveyard? Yeah.

Posted By: Havrekjex (11/28/2012 1:41:45 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
A 2/1 with *Trample* that can regenerate for 1 mana? For 2cmc that's already good.  
Add in the fact that it's gets bigger while also enabling recursion decks (which happen to be my fave)? Makes him even more useful.   
  
Will fit well in my B/G [Recurring Nightmare](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Recurring Nightmare) deck. [Birds of Paradise](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Birds of Paradise) Turn 1; Buried Alive or this guy Turn 2 depending what's in hand. I think I like.  
  
4/5. Fun and versatile.

Posted By: Jhyrryl (2/4/2013 10:52:05 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Just compare this thing to [Drudge Skeleton](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Drudge Skeleton). By replacing ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol) with ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol), you get:  
\* +1 to power, so you can hit things harder  
\*An awesome discard outlet/permanent pump ability  
\*Trample, so all that extra power isn't wasted  
\*A creature type with stronger tribal support  
  
Combine that with that fact that virtually no removal currently in standard includes the "can't be regenerated" phrase, and you've got yourself a pretty efficient beatstick.
posts.html:
Just compare this thing to Drudge Skeleton. By replacing with , you get:
* +1 to power, so you can hit things harder
*An awesome discard outlet/permanent pump ability
*Trample, so all that extra power isn't wasted
*A creature type with stronger tribal support

Combine that with that fact that virtually no removal currently in standard includes the "can't be regenerated" phrase, and you've got yourself a pretty efficient beatstick.
